website_summaries.verdict: Good quality 5-pack of 7-inch blades with aluminum oxide grain, adaptable to worm drive saws.
pros: Proprietary material mix and aluminum oxide grain ensure long life and fast cutting of carbon steel and other ferrous metals
2 full sheets of fiberglass for durability and safety
Includes diamond knockout arbor for use with worm drive saws
cons: Almost all purchasers were very satisfied, especially with the 5-pack value of these blades
Use caution if using on sheet steel or long pieces of metal

customer_reviews.title: Did a good job on galvanized steel.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to cut up a 16' steel garage door into smaller chunks that would fit in my vehicle for recycling. I took it apart first, so there wasn't anything much deeper than 1" cut. Used my 30-year-old Craftsman saw, not worm-drive. Did a good job with a steady feed, it only slowed down when I got a bind in the kerf. Took about an hour to take everything apart and cut it up. Used up about 1/2 of one blade. Wore long sleeves and eye protection, sparks were flying. I got about the same amount for the scrap as I did buying the blades, which is an argument for a bigger vehicle, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: M. Frobisher

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: Using a circular saw, I cut up an old, heavy stair master exercise machine that was too heavy and old to bother moving or selling. Took about a half hour and I went through 3 of these blades. I made approximately two dozens cuts through heavy, 1/8 inch thick steel tubes as well as 4 cuts through 1 inch solid sections. The blades did well and lasted about as long as I would have expected.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A. Mckean

customer_reviews.title: Suggest you don't cut sheet steel.
customer_reviews.text: Do these work to cut tube steel and square steel? Yes. Do these work to cut sheet steel? Maybe. The reason I say maybe is you should be extremely careful cutting long pieces with these wheels. I have seen them blow up from lateral force applied from cutting long angles of steel sheet. They are extremely loud but leave a very clean cut. These are attached to a basic skill saw I purchased from Home Depot. Wear glasses!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Put one in my old Craftsman circular saw, and cut through 1/4" steel diamond plate with no problem. I got a nice straight line, and it gave me about 5' of cutting through the plate before I had to change the disk. Best I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Schotty456

customer_reviews.title: May be good for small  jobs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take down a 4 inch square metal gate post. The metal is 1/4 inch thick. The blade does cut the metal, but the process for this application is very slow. I do not believe that these blades are the solution to cut a lot of 1/4 inch steel.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hayashi

customer_reviews.title: Lots of sparks, good clean cut
customer_reviews.text: These blades do what they're supposed to do: cut metal.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Potts

customer_reviews.title: ... use these disks to cut rebar and they work great. I install them in an old sjil saw
customer_reviews.text: I use these disks to cut rebar and they work great. I install them in an old sjil saw. Buying them in a 5 pack makes them more economical. Would recommend them to anyone for cutting light metal.
customer_reviews.author: Tax Man

customer_reviews.title: Did what I had hoped.
customer_reviews.text: Does what I was hoping for. Be sure and wear eye protection and gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Cut a watertank to make a rocket stove. Achieved my objective.
customer_reviews.author: william byars

customer_reviews.title: Cut off wheels
customer_reviews.text: The price was good. I had around 150 sheets of tin to cut and they worked good.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S.

customer_reviews.title: These discs do not cut. I have to melt ...
customer_reviews.text: These discs do not cut. I have to melt my way through a piece of steel. I'm going back to my local supplier.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Glad I ordered the 4 blade discount
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job at cutting rebar. I made about 14 cuts through 5/8" rebar and hardly see any wear on this blade.
customer_reviews.author: Purviance

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I use these for cutting aluminum and steel sheet and it works well. I would definitely recommend these to anyone cutting thin metals. I have never tried them on anything thick, but believe they would work ok on some thicker stuff.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used them yet but look good and price was good.
customer_reviews.author: DesertLarry

customer_reviews.title: Good blades
customer_reviews.text: Cut "R" panel just fine for the storage shed I'm building. I just wish they lasted longer, but making lots of cuts.
customer_reviews.author: jim anderson

customer_reviews.title: more versatile than the teeth.
customer_reviews.text: I like having this in the saw instead of the teeth. Still cuts wood, and everything else too.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've been using DeWalt cutoff blades for years. Never a problem
customer_reviews.author: Pepperdogger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price and quality product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price and quality product. Used them to cut corrugated steel. The blades wear down fairly quickly (1 blade = about 20ft of cut metal), but that's why they come in a pack of 5.
customer_reviews.author: J. Godoy

customer_reviews.title: Cut 1/8 " plate steel for a project- seemed to ...
customer_reviews.text: Cut 1/8 " plate steel for a project- seemed to last longer than the ones bought from the discount houses (HF).
customer_reviews.author: Greg Bode

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt replacement cut off wheel promoted does not fit the Neiko 10821A 3/4 HP High-Speed 7-inch cut off saw.
customer_reviews.text: Don't purchase this add-on option with the Neiko 10821A 3/4 HP High-Speed 7-inch cut off saw. It is not the correct cut off wheel. I got the 5 pack and when it came time to replace the original wheel the return window had expired on the DW3511B5 version. I went to Home Depot and got the Dewalt DW8725 wheels. They fit on the spindle correctly and will fit under the "spark diversion guard". The 7" wheel is too big around. The saw is great with the correct replacement wheels. This is the only way I can see that I can alert others to check it out before they purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Withers

customer_reviews.title: Better Lasting Cut Off Disc
customer_reviews.text: Use these for scrapping with the circular saw. Not bad , always wish for one that lasts longer but these do not overwork the tool. I think they last longer then the cheapo's at Home Depot. If I bought them here online, they must have been cheaper, probably due to the value pack deal.
customer_reviews.author: Zappato

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the expensive 7
customer_reviews.text: Cut through corrugated metal roofing sheets with ease using a circular saw. Much better than the expensive 7.25" metal saw blade i used on another roof.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Hosmer

customer_reviews.title: Chew that metal up and make sparks fly
customer_reviews.text: Did you know that the particles eroding off these wheels are really hot and will burn right through the tops of running shoes? Yowza. Then you find out just how still you can keep your foot so you don't make things even worse by jumping around, knocking stuff over. You also might want to remove any sawdust from the shop floor so you don't set fire to it. Not that I did, or anything like that....I'm just saying....
customer_reviews.author: R. Boutros

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt metal saw blade
customer_reviews.text: My husband has tried this new saw blade and is very pleased with the performance. If this did not suit his purpose, he would have returned it. P Pratt
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: cut 1/2" rebar well
customer_reviews.text: After watching a youtube video, I made a small jig to cradle the rebar while cutting. I purchased the 5 pack, but I used only 1 and it is still in excellant shape. The only "non-issue" problem was the diamond hole was slightly smaller than my Skil Wormdrive mount. But I carefully tightened it down successfully.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: I've used these for a long time, mostly for ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for a long time , mostly for a WildCat side grinder . If it can handle one of these it'll handle just about anything however this can be a very nasty tool trying to cut tubing unless very small and then barely a maybe . Using it with my skill saw tubing is a snap . A big company I worked for bought nothing else . Just ordered more .
customer_reviews.author: deebar54

product_meta.title: DEWALT 7-Inch Metal Cutting Blade, 5-Pack (DW3511B5)
product_meta.description:
DEWALT High Performance Metal Cutting Abrasive Saw Blades have aluminum oxide grain for long life and fast cutting. The proprietary material mix ensures durable long life wheels. They have 2 full sheets of fiberglass for durability and user safety. They have 5/8-Inch arbor with a diamond knockout arbor for use with worm drive saws. Each wheel has a cutting edge 1/8-Inch think and can be operated at up to 8700rpm.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
DEWALT High Performance Metal Cutting Abrasive Saw Blades have aluminum oxide grain for long life and fast cutting. The proprietary material mix ensures durable long life wheels. They have 2 full sheets of fiberglass for durability and user safety. They have 5/8-Inch arbor with a diamond knockout arbor for use with worm drive saws. Each wheel has a cutting edge 1/8-Inch think and can be operated at up to 8700rpm.
feature_bullets: Aluminum oxide grain for long life and fast cutting
Proprietary material mix ensures durable long life wheels
2 full sheets of fiberglass for durability and safety
Diamond knockout arbor for use with worm drive saws
High performance cutting of carbon steel and other ferrous metals

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars96 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
